inputs.label: Model Name
inputs.name: modelName
inputs.description: The name of the model to query.

inputs.label: Top K
inputs.name: topK
inputs.description: The topK parameter is used to limit the number of choices for the next predicted word or token. It specifies the maximum number of tokens to consider at each step, based on their probability of occurrence. This technique helps to speed up the generation process and can improve the quality of the generated text by focusing on the most likely options.

inputs.label: Top P
inputs.name: topP
inputs.description: The topP (nucleus) parameter is used to dynamically adjust the number of choices for each predicted token based on the cumulative probabilities. It specifies a probability threshold, below which all less likely tokens are filtered out. This technique helps to maintain diversity and generate more fluent and natural-sounding text.

inputs.label: Temperature
inputs.name: temperature
inputs.description: A decimal number that determines the degree of randomness in the response. A value of 1 will always yield the same output. A temperature less than 1 favors more correctness and is appropriate for question answering or summarization. A value greater than 1 introduces more randomness in the output.

inputs.label: Repeat Penalty
inputs.name: repeatPenalty
inputs.description: A number that controls the diversity of generated text by reducing the likelihood of repeated sequences. Higher values decrease repetition.

inputs.label: Streaming
inputs.name: streaming
inputs.description: Whether or not to stream tokens as they are generated

inputs.label: Max Tokens
inputs.name: maxTokens
inputs.description: Limit the number of tokens generated.

inputs.label: Stop Sequence
inputs.name: stop
inputs.description: A list of tokens at which the generation should stop.

inputs.description: Works together with top-k. A higher value (e.g., 0.95) will lead to more diverse text, while a lower value (e.g., 0.5) will generate more focused and conservative text. (Default: 0.9). Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Top K
inputs.name: topK
inputs.description: Reduces the probability of generating nonsense. A higher value (e.g. 100) will give more diverse answers, while a lower value (e.g. 10) will be more conservative. (Default: 40). Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Mirostat
inputs.name: mirostat
inputs.description: Enable Mirostat sampling for controlling perplexity. (default: 0, 0 = disabled, 1 = Mirostat, 2 = Mirostat 2.0). Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Mirostat ETA
inputs.name: mirostatEta
inputs.description: Influences how quickly the algorithm responds to feedback from the generated text. A lower learning rate will result in slower adjustments, while a higher learning rate will make the algorithm more responsive. (Default: 0.1) Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Mirostat TAU
inputs.name: mirostatTau
inputs.description: Controls the balance between coherence and diversity of the output. A lower value will result in more focused and coherent text. (Default: 5.0) Refer to <a target=

inputs.name: numCtx
inputs.description: Sets the size of the context window used to generate the next token. (Default: 2048) Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Repeat Last N
inputs.name: repeatLastN
inputs.description: Sets how far back for the model to look back to prevent repetition. (Default: 64, 0 = disabled, -1 = num_ctx). Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Repeat Penalty
inputs.name: repeatPenalty
inputs.description: Sets how strongly to penalize repetitions. A higher value (e.g., 1.5) will penalize repetitions more strongly, while a lower value (e.g., 0.9) will be more lenient. (Default: 1.1). Refer to <a target=

inputs.label: Stop Sequence
inputs.name: stop

inputs.label: Tail Free Sampling
